I beg your pardon.translation[0].definit: used to ask someone to repeat what they have just said
‘The meeting’s on Wednesday.’ ‘I beg your pardon?’ ‘I said the meeting’s on Wednesday.’
used to say sorry when you have made a mistake, or said something wrong or embarrassing
Oh, I beg your pardon. I thought you said 15 pence, not 50.
used to show that you strongly disagree with something that someone has said, or think it is unacceptable
‘Chicago’s an awful place.’ ‘I beg your pardon, that’s where I’m from!’
